message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of computing optimal repairs for inconsistent databases, specifically focusing on the case where the integrity constraints are Functional Dependencies (FDs). This problem is a fundamental one in the field of databases, and is therefore likely to be classified under cs.DB. Additionally, the paper presents a polynomial-time algorithm for computing an optimal subset repair (optimal S-repair) under certain conditions, which involves techniques from computational complexity (cs.CC) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also draws connections to past work on finding a "most probable database" that satisfies a set of FDs, which is related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper involves analysis techniques for the complexity of computing an optimal update repair (optimal U-repair), which could potentially fall under cs.DS (data structures and algorithms).
